title: Mission Description
content: Upon returning to the Vortex of Genesis, (Trailblazer) and Phainon returned the final Coreflame together, but rather than journeying to the new world as expected, they were pulled into an "Immersive Theater" by Lygus.

line: Take this wish with you... Be the one who begins it all...
As the prophecy foretold: "You will bear the blazing sun, until the pale dawn breaks" ...
Continue onward... bearing this world upon your shoulders... until the ashen hero... the nameless Deliverer ushers in the dawn...

speaker: Phainon
line: Such an odd dream...

speaker: Phainon
line: Strange... like I've dreamed this before. But it all slips away when I wake.

speaker: Phainon
line: Only a voice remains... who was that...?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What?

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah, it's you... Whoops, fell asleep there.

speaker: Phainon
line: What a strange dream I had. It's gone now though. But look! Perfect sunshine! The day's still young!

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's go find Cyrene, partner. We promised to be there for her oracle card reading today. It's right about time...

speaker: Phainon
line: Looking at you, someone's still half asleep. Tell you what, catch some fresh air first. I'll hang around here.

text: The Era Nova... is it done?

speaker: Lygus
line: Beautiful, isn't it? This is Aedes Elysiae , home of the nameless hero who carried Kephale 's Coreflame.

speaker: Lygus
line: When he was young and innocent, he had heroic dreams, imagining his wooden sword was forged of iron...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...pretending the straw dummy propped up by a wooden pole was a giant with a single blood vessel running from spine to heel...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...dreaming of slaying the giant and becoming a hero to save the world — though to his young mind, the "world" was just this small village .

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: Sharp as ever. Indeed, these memories you witness are the first steps of his journey...

text: How does this connect to Era Nova?

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: What you witness is the start of his path to a new world. And trust me, you play no small part...

text: I had no idea he used to be so chuuni.

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: Witty as always. But this is more than just a funny story. It's the start of his path...

speaker: Lygus
line: These are his first memories. Rather than watching, why not join in? Think of it as "immersive theater"...

speaker: Lygus
line: Become his lifelong closest friend, witnessing his hero's journey from the best seat in the house, as the nameless hero whose unwavering guidance shaped Phainon's destiny, yet whose name was never recorded in Amphoreus's history.

text: Who could possibly be there his entire life?
What exactly do I need to do?

speaker: Lygus
line: Questions, questions... Let's follow along and find out, shall we?

speaker: Lygus
line: Many mysteries lurk in this village beneath the Veil of Evernight ...

speaker: Lygus
line: Your questions will find answers as the story unfolds.

speaker: Phainon
line: All awake now? Great, let's go see Cyrene.

speaker: Child
line: Phainon, show me how to use a sword like you do!

speaker: Phainon
line: Wait till you grow a bit more!

speaker: Hunter
line: Hey Phainon! Where you headed? No Cyrene today?

speaker: Phainon
line: That's exactly where I'm going!

speaker: Phainon
line: Found you!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Goodness! Look at you rushing about... you've got the poor swing all startled...

speaker: Cyrene
line: ...Hmm?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Hmm... There's something oddly unfamiliar about this.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: It's that déjà vu~♪

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I knew it was you ♪

speaker: Phainon
line: Something wrong? What do you see?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Oh~ nothing much, just... suddenly felt a strange connection.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Look at you, leaves in your hair! Were you sleeping in a tree again, or was it the wheat fields this time? At least brush yourself off before wandering around.

speaker: Phainon
line: Come on, I'm not a kid anymore, you're the only one who still treats me like one...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Sure, sure. You may have the height advantage, but when it comes to maturity? I'm leagues ahead.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Still fantasizing about being in heroic adventures and imagining yourself as one of the characters. That's the kind of thing kids do, not grown-ups.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Don't you agree? And since you're playing along with his antics... who are you pretending to be today?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ *awkward cough* Well... ( he / she ) hasn't decided on a character for today yet.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: How about we stick with the usual? You know, the valiant hero from a distant shore who made a pact to learn the sword from you?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ *clearing throat* ( Uh... / Ah... ) today ( he / she ) he's going with "Stellaron Hunter."

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Steal-a-heart Hunter? Planning to steal someone's heart, are we?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Switching roles again? What happened to being the valiant hero from a distant shore who made that solemn pact to learn the sword...

text: Greetings. I'm the Invincible Galactic Baseballer!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ▶ *clearing throat* Uh... today ( he / she ) 's going with "Invincible Galactic Baseballer."

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Switching roles again? What happened to being the valiant hero from a distant shore who made that solemn pact to learn the sword...

speaker: Phainon
line: Spare me! Can we not bring this up?

speaker: Phainon
line: Speaking of which, what about those oracle cards? We haven't done divination in forever. Why the sudden interest?

speaker: Cyrene
line: I was just about to tell you. Earlier, while napping on the swing, I had the strangest dream...

speaker: Cyrene
line: There was this mysterious voice in my dream, calling out for something...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Wait, you had that dream too?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Yes... you too? That would explain this lingering sense of unease...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Which made me think of those old oracle cards I used to play with as a kid — though the Oronyx prophecies were always hit or miss.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yeah, all the kids would get so excited drawing cards like "Ruler" or "Warrior," but throw fits over "Devil" or "Drunkard" and demand a redo.

speaker: Phainon
line: If you just redo it when you don't like the result... what's the point of divination?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Ah, the blessing of childhood. Believing the gods might not notice our little corner of Aedes Elysiae, willing to let our small deceits slide...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Still... fate is absolute. After all, we never really know just how far into the future the prophecy extends.

speaker: Phainon
line: Anyway, let's go to our old "secret base" and look for those oracle cards—

speaker: Phainon
line: Um... now where did we hide those...

speaker: Cyrene
line: I can think of a few spots... Let's go check it out.

text: Find oracle cards in the Sacrament Courtyard

title: Step Description
content: The "theater" is actually someone's childhood memories, staged in the Aedes Elysiae of old. (Trailblazer), with many questions in mind, assumes the role of this person's "most important companion," joining him and Cyrene on their search for something important...

speaker: Cyrene
line: In a village this size, I bet all our childhood treasures are exactly where we hid them.

speaker: Phainon
line: Mm-hmm, time must be keeping them safe for us.

speaker: Old Woman
line: Slow down, kids! You'll trip!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Thank you! We'll be careful!

text: (Investigate the cart near the barn, optional)
▶ In the sunlit barn, amid the scent of ripened wheat, they found various fruits hoarded by squirrels, and... a wooden figurine missing arms and legs.

speaker: Phainon
line: My unfinished little soldier? After all these years...

speaker: Phainon
line: Hey, this is the one Mrs. Pythias confiscated! Finally back in my hands...

speaker: Pythias
line: Phainon, Cyrene? Where are you two headed?

speaker: Phainon
line: Speak of the devil... Mrs. Pythias? Is school out already?

speaker: Pythias
line: No classes today. This morning, I used fallen leaves for a reading, seeking Oronyx 's wisdom. They warned of potential injuries, so I gave everyone a holiday.

speaker: Pythias
line: Besides, it's harvest season. There's plenty of other work to be done even without classes.

speaker: Cyrene
line: With you being our only teacher in Aedes Elysiae, you must be working so hard.

speaker: Pythias
line: Anything for my students. I don't mind the work.

speaker: Pythias
line: When you travel far from here, you must visit the Grove of Epiphany for me, to see what a true haven of wisdom looks like...

speaker: Pythias
line: ...By the way, what are you looking for in here? You've been searching quite thoroughly.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Thank you, my friend! Time to take our soldier home!

children.speaker: Pythias
children.line: Is this... a toy? Really now, aren't we past the age for these?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: She doesn't remember, eh? This little soldier's coming with me.

children.speaker: (Trailblazer)
children.line: ▶ Mrs. Pythias, it's Phainon's toy!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hey, partner, keep it down...!

children.speaker: Pythias
children.line: Is this... a toy? Really now, aren't we past the age for these?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: She doesn't remember, eh? This little soldier's coming with me.

speaker: Pythias
line: Alright then, I should be going. It might rain tonight, so don't stay out too late!

speaker: Cyrene
line: So this is where the wooden figurine you carved during class ended up. And here I thought I knew all your hiding spots.

speaker: Phainon
line: To be honest, I'd forgotten all about it myself...

text: (Talk to Piso near the water, optional)

speaker: Livia
line: It's mine. I caught it fair and square!

speaker: Piso
line: You did not! It's mine!

speaker: Livia
line: Phainon, Cyrene, come quick! Look at this huge bottle I just caught!

speaker: Piso
line: Give it here! My rod, my catch. I only let you borrow it, remember?

speaker: Phainon
line: What's got you two so worked up? Here, show me...

children.text: A handwritten letter sealed in the glass vial. On the wheatgrass-stitched paper, the handwriting blurs at the edges, softened by seeping water. Dear straynger who finds this drift bottle in the future, It's currently the Month of Fortune, the final month of the year. Everyone in the village says if you do something tied to fortune on the last day of this month, you might be blessed with unexpeckted good luck. So, I decided to write this letter and cast it into the sea. Just let the currents decide where it goes. I want to share a little about our village... and my dream. Our little village is called Aedes Elysiae. Have you ever heard of it? Let me tell you a bit about it: We've got golden wheat fields that ripple like the sea, and tall, tall trees that shed their leaves. Right in the center of the village stands a statue of Oronyx. At the end of each year, the village gathers to celebrate the Winter Solstice. We leave offerings at the statue: roast graype pies, herb-fryed fish, goat's milk... all kinds of tasty food. Last year, I sneaked some malt candy and ended up with a tooth ripped straight out. Mom and Dad said if you throw a lost tooth under a tree, or bury it beneath a rock, a new one will grow back. Just like a seedling sprouting from the soil. I remember searching and searching, pushing through the tangled grass behind our courtyard, until I found this mysterious hole. I tossed the tooth inside, cupped my hands like a horn, and yelled, "Heeey — come ouuuut!" Nothing happened. When I went back this year... the whole was gone. Weird, right? You don't think I'm being childish, do you? I'm not like Cyrene. She can already host the festival, and she's great at telling the future with orecale cards. They say the card you draw shows what kind of person you'll become. Last time, I drew the "Deliverer." Everyone went "Woooow." People really like the Deliverer, but I'd rather be a Wonderer or a Skholar. Well, being a Deliverer sounds super amayzing, but it also means carrying a really, really heavy herden. I'm not that amazing, so I can't be the Deliverer. Few in Aedes Elysiae ever jerney far. We don't hear much about the outside world. All I know is there are all kinds of city-states out there and lots of great heroes. The bad part is, they're always at wars. I don't like wars. If the world were more like our village, where everyone knows each other and works together, harvesting grain, hearding sheep, why would we even need a Deliverer? But Mrs. Pythias and Uncle Galba both say that one day, when I'm a little older, I should go see the world for myself. If I could go anywhere, I'd visit the mighty Castrum Creamnose, find the greatest craftsman, and ask them to forje me a sword. With that sword, I'd protect our little village. I want no part in wars. Right now, I don't even have a sword of my own, just a stick and a hoe. Oh! And by then, I hope the outside world no longer needs a Deliverer. That would be the best thing ever. So that's my home, and that's my dream. What about you? What's your home like? What do you dream of? You could write it down, too. Toss it into the sea, and let the tides carry it to the next stop. Whoops! Just realized this letter has missspeelings, just like my essays in Mrs. Pythias's class. Please don't let her be the one who finds this, or I'm totally getting points docked and detenshun!

speaker: Phainon
line: Wait a second... this is... This is my old Wish-In-A-Bottle! How did it end up here?

speaker: Livia
line: Ooh, I wanna see! What did little Phainon wish for?

speaker: Phainon
line: Not happening. This stays sealed.

speaker: Female voice coming from afar
line: Piso! Livia! Dinner's ready!

speaker: Piso
line: Coming, Mom!

speaker: Livia
line: Finally. I'm starving! See you later!

speaker: Phainon
line: You know what's funny? I really thought tossing that bottle into the sea would carry our wishes beyond Aedes Elysiae... maybe even bring something back to us...

speaker: Phainon
line: Never thought... the waves would end up pushing it back ashore.

text: Funny how the past finds its way back.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Kind of disappointing, isn't it...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Don't bother... It's just some silly childish nonsense... Nothing worth reading.

text: Seems more like a lake to me than an ocean.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Ah... well, that would explain it. What a shame.

text: (If the player searched in the barn and near the water)

speaker: Cyrene
line: No sign of the oracle cards...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Let's see... Ah! There's one place we haven't checked yet.

speaker: Phainon
line: Those were the days. We'd always meet either by that statue in the village or right here.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Right! And I remember you never used the front door when you wanted me to come play. You always climbed over the wall. You were such mischief-makers!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Just like a certain someone who has a habit of showing up unexpectedly, right?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Maybe it's you~♪

text: Can't pin me down, can you?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: ▶ Ha! I bet ( he / she ) said something clever just now.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Oh, giving me the silent treatment? How cruel!

speaker: Phainon
line: *ahem* Hey, I was just copying those storybook heroes. They never take the beaten path!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Still, it's embarrassing, I've been the only one here for a while, and I haven't kept up with the cleaning. With so many spots to check, where should we even start?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Come to think of it, I haven't checked the roof in forever. Worth a shot, right?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Leaves have taken over the courtyard...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I know, I know. We wouldn't want your clothes getting dirty. Leave the dirty work to me.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: That's not what I meant at all.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: A cellar? I think I remember one... It was deep... so very deep...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Well, if we're talking wonderland stuff, it's not that different from my hero stories.

speaker: Phainon
line: Alright, let's split up. I'll handle the yard, you check the upper floor.

text: Go to the attic to find oracle cards

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (I wonder what the view's like from up there... Worth checking out?)

speaker: Phainon
line: Leave this to me, partner. Want to bet who finds the oracle cards first?

text: ▶ The girl before you carries an air of mystery, her secrets elusive, yet her demeanor toward you is exceptionally warm...
▶ You can't help but wonder: Could there really be some kind of mental connection?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Mmm... the view here hasn't changed a bit.

speaker: Cyrene
line: You know, besides the swing under the big tree, this has to be my favorite spot in all of Aedes Elysiae.

text: It does lift your spirits, being up high.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: You can't help but want to hum one of those old songs we used to sing...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: "Why do leaves and branches grow, which way does the wind blow...♪"

text: The sea stretches out as far as the eye can see...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I remember drawing Aedes Elysiae as a child, nestled between the sea and the mountains.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I'd always stop where the sky met the sea. The world beyond was just too vast to imagine.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Hey, what are you doing? Please be careful!

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I'm just a small-time diviner. I can't turn back time if something happens!

speaker: Cyrene
line: They always said I'd become the next Priest of Time , just because I heard prophecies as a child.

speaker: Cyrene
line: But here's the thing. The more divinations I do, the more doubt creeps in. I want to believe the prophecies, but actually leaving Aedes Elysiae...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Where will that waiting ship take us, I wonder...

speaker: Phainon
line: Here they are! The oracle cards—

text: Looks like he won this race.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Guess reminiscing makes us take our time, doesn't it?

text: I was still taking in the scenery.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: I've captured it all in my heart. This view, and most precious of all... my childhood friends!

speaker: Cyrene
line: There we go! Looks like the gods do listen to our thoughts.

speaker: Phainon
line: Here it is! This is the box where we kept the cards.

speaker: Cyrene
line: But the cards are gone... Who could have taken them?

speaker: Phainon
line: Huh? What's this underneath?

children.text: One two three four five six seven Do re mi fa sol la ti! — Stamped: Paw Print

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: No way, someone's switched them out...

text: One, two, three, four, five... Dan Heng and Voidranger jive...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hey, don't go changing the words!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Ah, I see now! Those sneaky little ones... So that's what they've been up to.

speaker: Phainon
line: The ones from Membrance Maze, you mean?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Yep. Let's head to the back of the courtyard.

text: Follow the two to the backyard of the garden

speaker: Phainon
line: The entrance should be around here somewhere...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Right here~ The path to the Maze is hidden under all these weeds. It's been too long since we visited the fairies.

speaker: Phainon
line: Did you forget? We used to visit them all the time when we were little.

speaker: Phainon
line: Alright, let's do this! These weeds need to go.

text: Follow the two to enter the Membrance Maze

speaker: Phainon
line: Pretty sure this is it... Should be this way...

speaker: Phainon
line: There it is! The entrance — that hollow in the tree—

speaker: Cyrene
line: Once you get through the tight squeeze in the hollow, you'll reach their dwelling, the Membrance Maze.

speaker: Phainon
line: Haha, I wonder if I can still squeeze through there...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Maybe worry more about whether the fairies will let you in! After all the Membrance Maze has an "invitation-only" rule, only children with pure hearts are welcomed.

text: Sounds like some secret society, huh?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Getting approved by the Maze's fairies was like our childhood badge of honor.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Lead the way then, partner.

text: My Trailblazer Profile should get me in, right?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: "Trailblazer Profile"... What's that?

speaker: Phainon
line: Regardless, how about we try getting through the hollow first?

speaker: Cyrene
line: After you, then?

speaker: Phainon
line: What? Oh, um... sure, I'll go first...

speaker: Cyrene
line: So hasty, as always...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Looks like it's just us now... Care to finish that chat?

speaker: Cyrene
line: To be honest, from the moment I saw the cute note left by the fairies, my intuition became even more certain...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Perhaps when we step into the Maze again after all these years, the wheels of fate will finally start turning.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Oh... just a girl's intuition.

text: Don't tell me you're behind all this.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: What if I am... what would you do?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Just kidding, don't read too much into it!

text: Once the wheels start turning, there's no going back...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Oh... it's just a girl's intuition. It might not mean anything.

speaker: Cyrene
line: But you know what? Even if fate is set on its path, no matter where it steers the world... If we're together, there's nothing to worry about, right?

speaker: Cyrene
line: So, if you're willing...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Ah~ forget it. If the wheels do begin to turn... that's when I'll make my request♪

title: Step Description
content: Deep in the Aedes Elysiae lies a "Maze." (Trailblazer) follows the two there and encounters many... fairy-like residents that resemble Mem?

speaker: Phainon
line: I made it! That wasn't easy... I can't remember the last time I came here.

speaker: Cyrene
line: We were still kids back then.
Wait a minute... Are you...
Look who it is! Reney and Snowy!
Woah... look who's finally back memi!
Snowy, you've grown so tall and dashing! I couldn't even tell it was you at first!

speaker: Phainon
line: We had to grow up sometime.
But look at Reney. She hasn't changed one bit! How fascinating!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Perhaps I'm like you, Relimem, just another fairy of the Maze?

text: Mem's... purple now? Did you dye your fur?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Dye? Relimem's always been this lovely shade of lavender.

text: So the Mems are like a organization?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: An organization? Hardly. They're not that organized... They didn't even have proper names before we came along.

text: The names just keep getting weirder...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Tell me about it! It took me forever to get all their names straight when I first came.

speaker: Phainon
line: Dolimem, Relimem, Milimem, Falimem... Ah, I've missed these cute little troublemakers.

speaker: Phainon
line: We used to gather around the fire, singing and dancing, imagining all our future journeys... Without coming back here, those memories might've faded away entirely.

speaker: Relimem
line: How could you, Snowy! You swore you wouldn't forget about us, but you were gone so long you almost did!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Oh, he's just copying those bards from his stories, being all melodramatic. He couldn't forget about you all even if he tried.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Actually, we're here for the oracle cards. Have you seen them?

speaker: Relimem
line: Oh, the oracle cards! Right, the chief asked us to get those!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Chief... you mean Dolimem?

speaker: Cyrene
line: What do they need the cards for? If they want a reading, they could just ask me.

speaker: Relimem
line: I'm not sure... but Chief specifically wanted to meet with you all.

speaker: Relimem
line: Let's see, they should be...

text: Follow Relimem to find the village chief

speaker: Relimem
line: ...That's it! This way, everyone.

speaker: Relimem
line: Watch your step, the trunk's slippery!

speaker: Relimem
line: Chief! Reney and Snowy have returned—

speaker: Dolimem
line: "Why do leaves and branches grow, which way does the wind blow..."

speaker: Dolimem
line: "In Membrance Maze depths we seek to find, the answers future left behind."

speaker: Dolimem
line: Hehe... welcome back, my dear children.

text: I thought you'd be a pink Mem.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Pink ones? That's strange. I don't recall any pink fairies in the Membrance Maze. Have you seen any, Chief Dolimem?

text: So, are the oracle cards with you?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: How about we hear what the chief has to say first, my impatient friend?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Right? Though Dolimem always says they're just songs, not poetry.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Oh Chief! You haven't changed a bit, still so full of life!

speaker: Dolimem
line: No need to fuss, my child. You haven't forgotten, have you? As long as our songs are sung, the children of the maze will live on—

speaker: Dolimem
line: —just as our paths stay forever linked.

speaker: Dolimem
line: Here, take it. I'm sorry I had to resort to such methods to bring you here.

speaker: Cyrene
line: My book of oracle cards...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Thank you for keeping it safe. You know you can always just ask if you want me to divine something.

speaker: Phainon
line: Still... bringing us here like this after so long... Is something wrong, Chief?

speaker: Dolimem
line: ...Yes.

speaker: Dolimem
line: The Veil of Evernight whispers to us once more. It tells of a new fairy who will soon enter the Maze...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Hmm...

speaker: Dolimem
line: Indeed. Every time a new fairy arrives in the maze, it means that Beyond the Veil, in the vast lands far from Aedes Elysiae, a great calamity is on the horizon.

text: Dolimem continues to explain in greater detail...

speaker: Cyrene
line: But if that's the case, our journey...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...will have to be cancelled. If disaster's coming, we should stay in Aedes Elysiae, just to be safe.

text: What were you planning to do?
What about all the people out there?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That's... that's a good point. But what difference could Cyrene and I make?

speaker: Cyrene
line: We weren't planning to be gone for long... just enough time to hone our abilities. Phainon would train in Castrum Kremnos, while I would seek the Fate Titans' blessing in Janusopolis...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Then we'd return to Aedes Elysiae, to help keep our village safe.

speaker: Phainon
line: It's okay. I can still practice my swordplay here. Some things you can learn on your own.

speaker: Phainon
line: Well... probably.

speaker: Dolimem
line: That's... not very convincing...

speaker: Dolimem
line: Here's a thought: Let's have Cyrene do a reading. If fate wishes to show us its path, we might find some peace of mind.

speaker: Phainon
line: But... What if we don't like what the cards tell us?

text: Then we stand against it, until the very end.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Heh... never thought of doing it that way before.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Thanks, partner. We'll do it your way — whatever the cards show, we'll face it together.

text: At least we'll know which way to run.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Not the most optimistic take, but I see your point.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Thanks, partner. We'll do it your way — whatever the cards show, we'll face it together.

text: I feel the same way. Perhaps it's better not to know.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hearing that from you... maybe we really shouldn't unveil the cards...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Why not take a look anyway? Even if it's not what we hope for, we'll know what we need to work on, don't you think?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You're right. Come on, partner — whatever the cards show, we'll face it together.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Ask with a true heart, and truth shall answer in kind.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Close your eyes, and let's open the Oracle Card Book together...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Let your thoughts flow like stars drifting on the river, carried by fireflies and gentle winds, your destinies flowing towards the same future...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Now, shall we begin?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Oh... Oh my... the cards are quite responsive today...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Very well, let's see what future the oracle cards wish to show us.

text: Turn to the first page of oracle cards.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Behold, the "Weaver." It connects the romantic threads of the "Chrysalis of Gold," weaving all destinies into golden silk that flows toward the most brilliant, magnificent future...

children.speaker: "Weaver"
children.line: A dance of thread and blade set the stage, so shall it end as gracefully as it started.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Such elegance... The Gold Weaver must be of noble birth.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Such high standing... I doubt someone like me could ever reach it.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: This is the "Gatekeeper," who guides people to their true path among myriad passages.

children.speaker: "Gatekeeper"
children.line: We have surrendered our countless senses, dedicating ourselves to the sacred whispers within the temple!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Wait... It almost feels like I can hear the echoes within a temple! And... are those children singing?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It feels overwhelmingly solemn, yet strangely comforting...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: The "Ruler" stands for discipline, authority and glory, but frequently also points to isolation and warfare.

children.speaker: "Ruler"
children.line: Even should you pledge your loyalty to me as the last sovereign, the glory shall be mine and mine alone...

children.speaker: "Ruler"
children.line: He who has slain a king can no longer bear the title. Let the withering lion walk his last path alone.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Is this showing us... a "Ruler" who forsook their people?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Stories of such bloodshed like this feel so distant from Aedes Elysiae... but they sure can stir the imagination.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Ah! The Traveler, our little trickster! Always hiding behind other cards, disguising itself. What a rare catch!

children.speaker: "Traveler"
children.line: ...Over here?

children.speaker: "Traveler"
children.line: Or perhaps — here?

children.speaker: "Traveler"
children.line: Gotcha! You'll have to be quicker than that!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That teasing voice... just like a child playing hide and seek. Surely, only a master of mischief could pick up this card!

text: Turn to the second page of oracle cards.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: This card, the Servant, is surprisingly light, bearing the cool scent of Antila flowers, just like starlight.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: It symbolizes new life and hope, yet often brings to mind struggles, sadness, and loss.

children.speaker: "Servant"
children.line: These precious flowers I care for with my own hands... are they destined to bloom only in death's embrace?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: It sounds so solemn, yet tinged with an inescapable sorrow...

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: The humble "Healer" may seem gentle in hue, but its courage matches any other, strong enough to melt even the coldest ice.

children.speaker: "Healer"
children.line: I will do my best to help you mend all fractures and let sunlight shine on every corner of the world!

children.speaker: "Healer"
children.line: Make a pinky promise with me. No more going back on your word!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Hey, this card really speaks to me. It makes me want to protect as much as I possibly can...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Still, "protecting everything everywhere" seems like a dream — what amazing power would you need for that?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Behold the Scholar, bearer of many names: the Grand Magician, the Great Performer, the Eye of Wisdom, and the Defiler of Cerces .

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Oh, there's just one card? With all those titles, I was expecting a whole deck...

children.speaker: "Scholar"
children.line: "A dromas draped in finery" will suffice — it's succinct enough to best summarize my true nature.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Wait, what's with that condescending tone? It's almost as if it knows what we're about to say.

speaker: Cyrene
line: The "Deliverer"... According to the tripartite prophecy, this card means absolute harmony and perfection.

speaker: Cyrene
line: In fact, it's the only oracle card without a dark side.

speaker: Phainon
line: What? No divine whispers this time?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Oh silly... this is simply the card you drew for yourself.

speaker: Lygus
line: The sleepy village of Aedes Elysiae in just one fleeting moment, welcomed an array of legendary figures: the Weaver, Gatekeeper, Ruler, Traveler, Servant, Healer, and Scholar...

speaker: Lygus
line: Their stories and wishes showed the village boy glimpses of a world larger than he'd ever imagined.

speaker: Lygus
line: They brought tales of raging battles, of cities crowned in holy light, and of wonders beyond his understanding... each story so far removed from his simple village life.

speaker: Lygus
line: Once, these were just images on his friend's oracle cards. And yet, destiny now stirs in resonance with the maze...

speaker: Lygus
line: And now, they are right in front of one's eyes.

speaker: Phainon
line: The Deliverer... this card again.

speaker: Dolimem
line: Ah, my child... It seems you're destined to bear the wishes of many, to answer the world's call.

speaker: Phainon
line: Bear their... wishes?

speaker: Dolimem
line: Yes. Just like Kephale , standing eternal atop the mountain.

speaker: Phainon
line: My parents... they only wished for me to grow up well, to help around the village, stay out of trouble...

speaker: Phainon
line: Mrs. Pythias wished for more books in her little schoolhouse, wanted us all to learn and grow. And little Piso... he wants to grow up strong like his father, to become a hunter...

speaker: Phainon
line: Is that my purpose? To fulfill their wishes?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Perhaps... for a true Deliverer, such wishes are but droplets in an ocean.

speaker: Cyrene
line: After all, Kephale bears the weight of the entire world.

speaker: Phainon
line: Right... How could any human possibly measure up to a Titan?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Mmm, I wonder too. Perhaps...

speaker: Phainon
line: What's this...?

speaker: Cyrene
line: What you see are futures written in the cards. Or rather, the people you'll meet on your journey.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Sometimes, fate can guide us when we're lost. Let's consult fate itself. Maybe then we'll know why we must take this path...

speaker: Cyrene
line: And learn... just how many burdens one must bear to become a true "Deliverer."

text: Talk to Cyrene about the future revealed by oracle cards

title: Step Description
content: The "oracle cards," childhood toys of Phainon and Cyrene, reflect the figures of Flame-Chase heroes, both familiar and strange. Do they symbolize the unyielding threads of fate? Or are they merely foggy backdrops on this theatrical stage? At this moment, (Trailblazer) could not yet tell.

text: (Listen to the Weaver and Gatekeeper, optional)

speaker: "Weaver"
line: Personal wishes? I have none. Only the Era Nova matters: The world's rebirth. Yet, if I am to weave a new era, then may it be one where Caenis and her Cleaners shall never tread.

speaker: "Weaver"
line: These crawling parasites have no place in Okhema, especially not under the deceitful claim of "human rule."

speaker: Phainon
line: That... noble lady? The way she speaks... it's like ice in my veins...

text: She's truly selfless in her dedication.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Huh... not exactly the warmth I'd expect from someone selfless...

text: She's as cold as winter frost.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That's exactly the feeling I'm getting...

speaker: "Weaver"
line: Teacher, perhaps you could share your wishes with us?

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: Oh Snowy... you wanna know about our wishes now?

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: I wish to meet Trianne again, in the sea of flowers where the west wind ends.

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: And Agy, I want to see you shed that golden-thread cocoon around your heart. Just once more, smile at us again like that bright-eyed girl in white who stood before the Janusopolis temple.

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: Finally, I pray that the footsteps of lost souls no longer wander aimlessly, instead, replaced by the bright songs of prayer.

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: Are we wishing for too much? Well, let's say these three wishes represent Trianne and Trinnon too!

speaker: Phainon
line: Those wishes... are truly wonderful. They even stir something deep inside me...

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: Then we can rest easy, because only "you" can make these wishes come true.

speaker: Phainon
line: Only... me?

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: Mark these words, Snowy! See you...

speaker: "Gatekeeper"
line: ...tomorrow!

text: (Listen to the Traveler, Servant, and Healer, optional)

speaker: "Traveler"
line: Well, well, if it isn't our little Deliverer!

speaker: "Traveler"
line: My wish? Ha! Just let me wine and dine and soak up the sun for another millennium or two. I mean, what's the point of dying rich if you never lived rich?

speaker: "Traveler"
line: Right, Princess Homebody?

speaker: "Servant"
line: Cipher, that's... not how I see it.

speaker: "Servant"
line: My one wish... is to find that missing piece in my life, to feel someone's embrace once more. That warmth... I've felt it before, and it's my dearest memory. And speaking of riches...

speaker: "Servant"
line: For someone with all those treasures behind your divine power... you've led a pretty cheap life~

speaker: "Traveler"
line: Ouch, where did that come from...

speaker: "Traveler"
line: Right for the jugular, huh?

speaker: "Traveler"
line: What about our friend from the Grove?

speaker: "Healer"
line: My wish came true before I touched the Sky. I transformed my healing power into gentle sunlight, distributing it equally to every life I cherished and loved.

speaker: "Traveler"
line: You two are so selfless, aren't you? No surprise Aglaea wanted you for the Flame-Chase Journey.

speaker: "Traveler"
line: You know what? I did have one wild dream, to know what it feels like being born a noble lady, drowning in riches.

speaker: "Traveler"
line: Just think, if I traded places with that seamstress! Me in the mansion, her on the streets! I'd like to see if she'd still become the "Goldweaver" then! Maybe I'd even take her place!

text: Can we jump in and fit right into their convo?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Doesn't sound like an easy task...

text: These wishes... they make you want to smile.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: I can't disagree with you. These wishes aren't weights to bear. They're like those candy wrappers the Aedes Elysiae children love, shining even brighter when bathed in sunlight.

speaker: Phainon
line: "Warm embrace," "equal healing," and... perhaps... "living free"?

speaker: Phainon
line: They're all wishing for a kinder world, in their own way.

speaker: "Scholar"
line: Ah, Phainon, my student, must we go over this again?

speaker: "Scholar"
line: Listen well. I detest the word "wish." It reeks of mortals crawling before their gods.

speaker: "Scholar"
line: My life's work is done. All that remains is for you to take the final step and prove the ultimate truth—

speaker: "Scholar"
line: I, Anaxagoras, shall become a god of the new world. Through irrefutable logic, I will prove that mortal wisdom can achieve divine greatness.

speaker: Phainon
line: Isn't he... you know, a little...?

speaker: Phainon
line: I mean, I just daydream about hero stories, but he's fantasizing about becoming a... Titan?

text: Careful — that's your future teacher you're talking about.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Well, that's... something. Could I ever be that sure of myself?

text: His ambitions rest on your shoulders.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Come on, you're joking right? Am I really being burdened with a dream that feels more like a fantasy?

speaker: "Ruler"
line: Phainon? Since when did you become so timid, asking such juvenile questions about wishes?

speaker: Phainon
line: What's that supposed to mean? And what's with that condescending tone...

speaker: Phainon
line: No way I become friends with this half-naked showoff, right?

text: Sorry to disappoint, but you end up being close friends.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Just what kind of life am I going to lead...

text: You'll be the kind of friends who think nothing of sitting shoulder to shoulder in a hot bath.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Horrifying... is that really something I'll enjoy one day?

speaker: "Ruler"
line: What are you mumbling to yourself now? Whatever...

speaker: "Ruler"
line: The wishes of the Kremnoan warriors are done. But I—

speaker: "Ruler"
line: I survived a thousand deaths only to fall to a coward's blade... That masked Flame Reaver who struck from behind.

speaker: "Ruler"
line: Phainon, you look...

speaker: "Ruler"
line: Never mind. That blank look tells me you're completely lost.

speaker: "Ruler"
line: My wish is simple: One honest duel. Face to face, blade to blade. Then I'll strip away that mask with my own hands.

speaker: Phainon
line: Nothing but violence and vengeance... this person's wish is nothing short of brutal.

speaker: Phainon
line: Still... those eyes burn with the noble pride I've read about. This wish, I shall not forget.

speaker: Cyrene
line: So tell me... has the uncertainty in your heart begun to fade?

speaker: Phainon
line: So many faces in my future... so many wishes...

speaker: Phainon
line: Still... why would fate choose to show us this path?

speaker: Dolimem
line: What's weighing on your mind?

speaker: Phainon
line: Didn't you say disaster would strike Amphoreus? If so, shouldn't Cyrene and I stay in Aedes Elysiae? How could we possibly meet all these people?

text: Even the darkest storm must eventually pass.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: That's... wonderfully optimistic. I like it.

text: Perhaps they'll come to Aedes Elysiae?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Our secluded village as humanity's last haven... That makes sense.

text: This calamity is what sets you on your journey.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: If that's true, then... who will protect everyone in Aedes Elysiae?

speaker: Phainon
line: Cyrene, may I have that "Deliverer" card?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Of course. But why?

speaker: Phainon
line: Although those voices, visages, and wishes may seem far away now...

speaker: Phainon
line: I can't ignore the sense that something is calling me, bidding me to take hold of it. Maybe... its true weight can only be known once it's in my grasp.

speaker: Cyrene
line: In that case...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Accept this gift: oracle cards carrying time's wisdom, blessed by Oronyx ...

speaker: Cyrene
line: May they journey with you, become your memories... and spark rippling waves of change in times to come.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'll hold these words close to my heart.

speaker: Phainon
line: But... now that I'm holding them, they don't seem all that different from ordinary playing cards...

speaker: Cyrene
line: What... what's happening?

speaker: Relimem
line: E—Everyone, we've got big trouble memi!

speaker: Relimem
line: Burning... smoke everywhere... It's all coming from beyond the Maze!

speaker: Phainon
line: ...What's going on!?

speaker: Dolimem
line: It's here... The seeds of disaster have already taken hold, sooner than we had foreseen.

speaker: Dolimem
line: This time... not even the Veil of Evernight can shield us.

speaker: Phainon
line: Y—You mean... Aedes Elysiae will be swept up in the prophesied catastrophe?

speaker: Dolimem
line: I'm afraid so...

speaker: Dolimem
line: My children, take shelter in the Membrance Maze. One step outside and this horror will consume you both.

speaker: Phainon
line: But my parents... the whole village...

text: We need to save them — now.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You're right. Chief, what are we truly facing? Is this the power of a Titan?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Are we facing the Three Titans of Calamity?

speaker: Dolimem
line: This is beyond any Titan, beyond any danger you could overcome with strategy alone.

speaker: Dolimem
line: It's an unspeakable horror that twists all life into abominations that never bleed nor cry. Even Titans fall to its corruption, burning from within until only empty shells remain, knowing only death and destruction...

speaker: Dolimem
line: The "black tide." That's what this calamity truly is. It consumes all in its path, sparing none but the Membrance Maze.

speaker: Phainon
line: Not even Titans can...

speaker: Dolimem
line: Yes. So please, don't leave this forgotten realm the gods abandoned — you are the first to uncover our presence, and the only two who can enter the Maze...

speaker: Dolimem
line: We... don't wish for you to throw your lives away.

speaker: Cyrene
line: We...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Phainon... what path do we take?

text: Stay here, safe in the Maze.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: As long as we survive, hope remains...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But... I just accepted the "Deliverer" card. To idly sit by and ignore this calamity now would be...

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: My heart...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: My heart knows but one path...

children.text: (Go back to dialogue choice with the option removed)

text: Protect those who must be protected.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...I learned the sword to protect those close to me. If I run now... I'll never be worthy of lifting a blade again.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Then we know what we must do.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Indeed. Our friend is right... we must take action.

speaker: Phainon
line: Forgive me, Chief! But Aedes Elysiae needs us... and as her child, I must act!

speaker: Dolimem
line: ...Very well. Make sure you protect yourselves.

speaker: Phainon
line: With me, Cyrene. Join us, my friend—

speaker: Phainon
line: Even without a sword, I'll take a rake! Even with the roughest steel, I'll keep our home safe!

speaker: Cyrene
line: "Deliverer"...

speaker: Cyrene
line: The card's truth extends beyond its mere literal meaning, there's another hidden layer within.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Not someone perfect from the start, standing high above, casting merciful gazes upon the world...

speaker: Cyrene
line: But one who starts small, from a humble village, expanding their "world within" step by step, learning to save others as they grow...

speaker: Cyrene
line: When we were little, I told him I wished this world would never need a Deliverer...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Now that wish has shattered, yet I'm glad... he's chosen to walk this path.

speaker: Cyrene
line: And all of this...

speaker: Cyrene
line: ...happened because you believed in him, friend.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Shall we? It's only when you're by our side that Phainon and I... that our hearts find their courage.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I know you're watching us right now... aren't you, "Great Hero" from the future?

speaker: Lygus
line: "Deliverer."

speaker: Lygus
line: Such cruel irony — though destined to bear the world's burden, this boy can never become the hero to bring forth the dawn.

text: Don't tell me... I'm the one who has to deliver salvation?
Are you here just to spoil the story?

speaker: Lygus
line: ▶ Follow their path, (Trailblazer). Bear witness as this man, forever denied the mantle of hero, takes his first step on the path to Deliverance.

speaker: Lygus
line: Watch this memory play out its final act. See with your own eyes how everything began ...

speaker: Lygus
line: Then you'll see why his dream of "Deliverance" was always destined to become this world's requiem.

title: Step Description
content: Faced with the oncoming "catastrophe," the Phainon of the past made his choice.And that very decision led him to the start of Flame-Chase Journey...

text: ▶ A sun red as blood, wheat fields turning to dust, and in the heart of it all, a village aflame—
▶ In that moment, the boy stood at what felt like the end of existence itself.

speaker: Phainon
line: These creatures... they're everywhere...

speaker: Phainon
line: Someone... anyone... where are you...

speaker: Monstrous Roar
line: Phai█ ███ █non █ ███ █

speaker: Phainon
line: No... it can't be...

speaker: Monstrous Roar
line: █Why █did██ █you█ ██ █?

speaker: Phainon
line: Y—You...

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you... talking to me?

speaker: Monstrous Roar
line: Weren't█ we███ █best█ ██ friends█ ███ forever██ █?

speaker: Phainon
line: No... that ribbon...

speaker: Phainon
line: Livia... no...

speaker: Phainon
line: I should have known...

speaker: Monstrous Roar
line: Saaaaave uuuus Saaaaave █ us█ █us█ ███ ██ █ ██ ███ ████

speaker: Phainon
line: Please... no...

speaker: Phainon
line: Stop... please stop...

speaker: Phainon
line: Oh, Livia... I'm so sorry...

speaker: Phainon
line: And these monsters... they're all...

speaker: Phainon
line: Ah...

speaker: Phainon
line: WHY... WHY IS THIS HAPPENING!?

speaker: Lygus
line: When the black tide arrived, the wavering boy found resolve in his companions, and together they ran toward their first battlefield.

speaker: Lygus
line: In the far-off future, the land of Amphoreus would bear the marks of the heroes' footsteps: With sword in hand, he would inscribe, an eternal mark in the Golden Epic.

speaker: Lygus
line: And when dawn broke over scorched earth, a boy, covered in wounds, buried the dead one by one, his silence heavier than the earth he moved...

speaker: Lygus
line: His home. His past. His name. All buried beneath the soil.

speaker: Lygus
line: His feet carried him forward. Over the Pillar of Stone . Beyond the Chalice of Plenty . Through the deadly fogs of the Hand of Shadow .

speaker: Lygus
line: He wandered without direction, like a withered leaf drifting in the wind. Through countless city-states, the smiling visage of the white-haired swordsman was etched into memories.

speaker: Lygus
line: Yet he did not walk without purpose. Deep in his heart, a voice always guided him forward to fulfill the wishes he had inherited, to brave peril, and to do all that was within his power to save those who needed saving.

speaker: Lygus
line: Those words his friend spoke long ago, when his journey began lingered...

speaker: Phainon
line: ▶ "Protect those who must be protected."

speaker: Lygus
line: The words were few. But they gave him all the certainty he needed.

speaker: Phainon
line: "That's what it means to be ordinary and choose to be more."

speaker: Lygus
line: Onward he walked until the call of the Flame-Chase Journey thundered across the land. In the vision painted by prophecy, humanity would triumph over the gods, seize the Coreflames, and ignite a new dawn for Amphoreus.

speaker: Phainon
line: "Yet losses are a constant on the Flame-Chase journey, where life, too, seems as small as a speck of dust."

speaker: Phainon
line: "Only one who treats the world as their teacher can bear its eventual destiny. Are you prepared for such teachings?"

speaker: Lygus
line: The voice within spoke, and he answered softly.

speaker: Phainon
line: "No matter. My existence is of no consequence."

speaker: Lygus
line: When the Goldweaver called, he answered, traveling to the holy city. There, the Elders met his warrior's spirit with nothing but scorn, condemning him to the barracks in derision.

speaker: Lygus
line: No one saw it coming. Not the world, not even him. Yet, this nameless recruit stood at the gates of legend...

speaker: Lygus
line: And there, at last, he found the ones who would walk his path right beside him.

title: Step Description
content: The second act of this "drama" is Phainon's first encounter with Mydei, the Kremnos prince we all know...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (This is... the Abyss of Fate...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Hold on. Phainon's here too? And is that Mydei and Trinnon?)

speaker: Lygus
line: And now, Act Two of our immersive drama unfolds.

speaker: Confused Priest
line: They're evacuating the Temple? Why now?

speaker: Panicked Priest
line: Are you insane? That blond man is the crown prince of Kremnos! Mess with him, and every last person in the city could wind up dead!

speaker: Rational Priestess
line: Calm yourselves. The Holy Maiden has everything under control. We need only wait patiently...

speaker: Lygus
line: Behold! It is the Month of Gate, Light Calendar 4926. The crown prince of Kremnos, Mydeimos, has led his forces to the gates of Okhema.

speaker: Lygus
line: As you know, though Mydeimos was proud, he did not engage in needless violence. He challenged the elders of Okhema to a duel, not for glory, but for the rights and dignity of his people. To ensure they wouldn't live as second-class citizens in foreign lands.

speaker: Lygus
line: After Aglaea's mediation, Phainon met Mydeimos's challenge as the elders' representative. This duel was to change the course of the Flame-Chase Journey itself...

speaker: Lygus
line: So, as Phainon's most important companion, his lifelong friend, please, continue to bear witness to his memories.

speaker: Mydei
line: ...Is this your idea of an honorable duel?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Bloodshed isn't the way. We and Agy don't want to see Chrysos Heirs turn on each other.

speaker: Trinnon
line: True warriors know when to sheathe their blades. The impartial Talanton shall oversee this duel. You need only place your offerings upon their scales...

speaker: Trinnon
line: ...Something that has more weight than the fate of the world.

speaker: Phainon
line: Which means only those who understand the world's weight are worthy to carry it... Is this how you plan to test our convictions?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, Kremnoan, looks like you won't be able to punch your way through this one.

speaker: Mydei
line: It makes no difference. One last chance, new recruit. Walk away, and I'll spare your life.

speaker: Mydei
line: Otherwise — come and face me! I'll give you a warrior's death!

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Hard to imagine they once clashed like this...)

speaker: Phainon
line: Holy Maiden, I can't help but feel like a pawn that has stumbled into some greater political game.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Every hero was once a child. And every child must grow.

speaker: Phainon
line: That so? I don't even know why I'm standing here right now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Look at me, just a common soldier. Since swordsmanship won't decide the winner, Lady Goldweaver should be here instead. My devotion to the holy city could never compare to hers.

speaker: Trinnon
line: What if we told you this duel isn't about winning or losing, but rather in the choice you make?

speaker: Phainon
line: Are you saying that Lady Goldweaver is testing me?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Every Chrysos Heir is indispensable to the Flame-Chase Journey. And you and the crown prince of Kremnos are both a part of the prophecy.

speaker: Trinnon
line: What the duel marks is not an ending, but a beginning. So, listen to your heart . We wish only to hear your answer.

speaker: Phainon
line: True enough... The voice within has never failed me. It doesn't matter what the result is... I'll give it everything I have.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Spoken like a Chrysos Heir. Now go, Phainon, your journey has only just begun.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's right, comrade! It's time for us to teach that proud prince a lesson together!

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Haha! Now that's what I like to hear!

text: Someday, he too will be your comrade.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Me? With him? Pfft, don't joke around like that...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Well... if we lose, we'll find out, won't we?

speaker: Phainon
line: Still, on the topic of the Temple of the Three Fates...

speaker: Phainon
line: Here we are, at the temple of the Time Titan, and I don't even know how Cyrene's studies are progressing... We haven't really had much contact since I set out...

speaker: Phainon
line: Still, I hope she's doing well. Anyway, let's go, comrade. It's not every day you get a chance to see Talanton's Scales of Justice.

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (What's going on...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Did he just say Cyrene's studying here? But how is that possible? Wasn't she...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Of course Lygus disappears right when I need answers...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ Forget it, I need to catch up with Phainon first.

speaker: Phainon
line: Amazing. Talanton may have fallen, but their scales remain true to their purpose.

speaker: Mydei
line: I hope you still remember your purpose, new recruit.

speaker: Phainon
line: You seem awfully confident, Kremnoan. Let's see how you define the idea of "weight."

speaker: Mydei
line: For your information, in Castrum Kremnos, the punishment for profaning a duel with such crooked words is impalement.

speaker: Mydei
line: But as we're in foreign lands, I'll indulge you—

speaker: Mydei
line: The Signet of Kremnos, the crown jewel of our people. That's my choice.

speaker: Phainon
line: A ring? Not just any ornament, I'd wager. What's the story behind this little treasure?

speaker: Mydei
line: Don't push your luck. Think I'd pour my heart out to you?

speaker: Mydei
line: Just know that Kremnos's thousand years of glory could bring a Titan to its knees, let alone a nobody like you!

speaker: Phainon
line: So to him, glory and his people outweigh the entire world...

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (And the very destiny that Mydei himself will eventually shoulder...)

speaker: Trinnon
line: Don't overthink it, Phainon. Trust your heart.

speaker: Phainon
line: That's easy for you to say. I'm just a Holy City Guard, up against Kremnos's walking war machine of a prince...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Don't you think this is a little bit too unfair!?

speaker: Phainon
line: Where are you going, comrade?

speaker: Phainon
line: Come back. We need to decide this here and now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Now this is a tough one. What can I possibly offer against a ring that signifies so much?

speaker: Phainon
line: Well, comrade? What does your gut tell you?

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: ...Looks like we really are on the same wavelength.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: This sword has been with me through every battle. One day, it'll help write a heroic epic...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: But not today. I'm still young, and I have a long road ahead. So does this blade.

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: You mean my conviction? But... just resolve isn't enough, is it? Unless I literally gave my heart...

children.speaker: Phainon
children.line: Ha! No way. Only an Aidonian would do something that crazy.

speaker: Phainon
line: In the end, there's only one thing I can trust...

speaker: Phainon
line: The "Deliverer" that appeared in my life on that day... How ironic. I can't even look at this card properly, much less follow where it leads.

speaker: Phainon
line: Just thinking about how my village was swallowed by the black tide makes my hands shake. The flames, the screams, my utter failure to protect anyone...

speaker: Phainon
line: Speaking rationally, I know it's not nearly enough. Aedes Elysiae was just a small village, its loss barely a scar on Amphoreus's face.

speaker: Phainon
line: But here and now, my heart says something else...

speaker: Phainon
line: This card... It's everything I have left. Nothing weighs heavier.
Perhaps that itself is the answer.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Look, Phainon...

speaker: Cyrene
line: It's so nice to see you all again! Lady Trinnon, Phainon, and...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Hello! Seeing you here sure is a sweet surprise♪

text: Did I stumble into the wrong Amphoreus?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Why so surprised? Could it be... did you miss me?

speaker: Phainon
line: Cyrene?

speaker: Phainon
line: This is... incredible. I was literally just thinking about how you might be here, but I never imagined I'd see you this soon.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Hehe, I was supposed to leave with the priests, but then I heard Lady Maiden was with a white-haired young man...

speaker: Cyrene
line: I figured it had to be you, so I snuck back here!

speaker: Phainon
line: Ha... That's Cyrene for you. Unfortunately, this isn't a good time for reminiscing. That Kremnoan over there...

speaker: Mydei
line: Still playing house, boy?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...You get the idea.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Quite the hothead. Y'know, you two just might get along.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Don't worry. You already know what the answer is, don't you?

speaker: Cyrene
line: If that's your choice, I am with you.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I am with you because I remember it all too. The fields of Aedes Elysiae, those red leaves, that little swing of mine beneath the tree where I'd dream the sweetest dreams. And those dear fairies in the Membrance Maze... It hurts so much knowing they're gone forever...

speaker: Cyrene
line: The pain speaks for itself. Our hometown may have been just a tiny village, but to us, it was the whole world.

speaker: Cyrene
line: But... that's not enough, Phainon. Not nearly enough.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Even though hatred can help people grow, and turn a boy into an unbreakable warrior...

speaker: Cyrene
line: What you need now is victory. You can't just stack the scales with your past suffering...

speaker: Cyrene
line: You have to throw the weight of your "future" onto them as well.

speaker: Phainon
line: The future...? What do you mean?

speaker: Cyrene
line: Maybe that was a bit too cryptic for you, but it's actually really simple!

speaker: Cyrene
line: Why not have our mutual friend here stand on the scales with the "Deliverer"?

speaker: Cyrene
line: How about it? Can you help us?

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Of course, after all... you're what we aspire to.

children.speaker: Cyrene
children.line: Hehe, relax, our dear crown prince won't have a clue~

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Let's try that.

speaker: Phainon
line: The fate of Okhema hangs on this duel. I must claim victory, for their sake.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will stake everything I have. Stand with me, comrade, and we shall become heroes.

text: Remember the past, and become the hero of tomorrow.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's. Together we'll prove that what weighs more than the fate of the world...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Is the resolve to shoulder an immutable past, and carry it into the future.

speaker: Trinnon
line: Talanton , the fair, the just, they of unassailable integrity — the challengers have made their choices.

speaker: Trinnon
line: In the name of the Holy Maiden of the Three Fates, lower your scales, weigh destiny, and reveal unto us your verdict!

speaker: Mydei
line: Your offering is... a card?

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, a flimsy little card. That is my choice. Just know that it's called the "Deliverer."

speaker: Mydei
line: Interesting. Very well — if you can beat me with this card, then that's what I'll call you from now on!

speaker: Phainon
line: It's a deal.

speaker: Cyrene
line: The scales... they're wavering...

speaker: Trinnon
line: Talanton is deliberating on the outcome. It appears the convictions of both sides are... equally matched.

speaker: Phainon
line: This is... suffocating. Like the whole world's weight is on my shoulders.

speaker: Phainon
line: But I believe... what my heart tells me...

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Mydei
line: Finally decided?

speaker: Trinnon
line: "Hear thee, children of humanity: I shall pronounce judgment, for the difference is now clear."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "The one whose offering weighs more than the fate of the world is—"

speaker: Trinnon
line: "One from Aedes Elysiae, the Nameless Hero."

speaker: Titan's Voice
line: *Titan's murmurs*

speaker: Trinnon
line: "However, heed this..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "The true weight of conviction originates not from itself..."

speaker: Trinnon
line: "...but rather in that which tips the scales, hope itself."

speaker: Mydei
line: What's that supposed to mean?

speaker: Cyrene
line: I think the Titan means that it's not anyone's personal convictions that outweigh the fate of the world.

speaker: Cyrene
line: It's about a wish, one which we all share — you, me, everyone here. What tipped the scales wasn't Phainon's conviction alone, but the collective hopes carried by this oracle card — humanity's desperate call for a Deliverer.

speaker: Phainon
line: Yes, even you and your people, Kremnoan.

speaker: Mydei
line: Placing us both on the same side of the scales? Foolish. We Kremnoans are your mortal enemies. Such weak idealism will only get you skewered on our spears.

speaker: Phainon
line: Fine by me. I've never claimed to be the Deliverer from the card anyway.

speaker: Phainon
line: I'm a soldier, and if it's my fate to bleed my last on the battlefield, then so be it. I'll fight to my last breath. And on this, I know that we're the same...

speaker: Phainon
line: That's all a "hero" really is. Someone with that kind of conviction. And the "Deliverer"? Just the sum of all those heroes.

speaker: Aglaea
line: A brilliant explanation.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Just as prophesied: "On this day, the final two heroes shall join the Flame-Chase Journey."

speaker: Mydei
line: I should have known from the start. They all say Lady Goldweaver is quite brazen, but you're the first to even imagine that prophecies could persuade a Kremnos warrior.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Oh, I have a thousand ways to tame a lion. But this lion didn't come here for bloodshed, did he?

speaker: Hyacine
line: The Kremnoans far outmatch Okhema's forces, yet we haven't lost a single soul. That's no accident, is it?

speaker: Mydei
line: Do you honestly think Kremnoans, renowned for our love of battle, would show mercy?

speaker: Trinnon
line: Your forces are equally renowned for their iron discipline.

speaker: Trinnon
line: And so, we can only assume that this is on your orders.

speaker: Mydei
line: Perhaps Okhema isn't as hidebound as the rumors say. You grasp the true marrow of power more clearly than those Elders.

speaker: Aglaea
line: Now that the wheels of fate are turning, what finer way to celebrate this fortuitous encounter than a feast?

speaker: Aglaea
line: Follow me, brave outlanders — heroes of this world are as countless as the stars, and at this moment, we find ourselves gathered here by the light of the flames of the long night...

speaker: Aglaea
line: History shall remember this moment. The prophesied Chrysos Heirs now stand assembled, heralding a new dawn for Amphoreus.

speaker: Lygus
line: You must see it now... How different this is from the Flame-Chase Journey you traveled.

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: I merely stepped backstage, so as not to disrupt your immersion.

text: And whose role am I playing?

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: "Who"? Perhaps the role is not that of a person who really existed. Notice how only two particular individuals seem aware of your presence?

speaker: Lygus
line: Patience. We're approaching the final act.

speaker: Lygus
line: These are, as I mentioned, his first memories. They are of particular importance for the imminent Era Nova.

speaker: Lygus
line: Such as this very moment, as the prophesized demigods gather with Talanton as witness...

speaker: Lygus
line: This is a moment calculated by the gods. What comes after is no different from that which you already know. Some join, others leave, while Flame-Chasers bear their faint light forward through the long night.

speaker: Lygus
line: Come, come, your seat awaits. After thirteen heartbeats—

speaker: Lygus
line: Our heroes will be ferried to the final scene.

title: Step Description
content: The third act, as it plays out before (Trailblazer), appears to mark the end of the Flame-Chase Journey. But the one who witnesses the world's end times with Phainon is Cyrene — the girl we believe to have perished in his childhood years.

speaker: Cyrene
line: They say that the heroes of this world should be as countless as the stars...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Yet now, we're the only ones left standing.

speaker: Cyrene
line: So, in the end, the black tide still swallowed everything...

speaker: Phainon
line: The west stands protected by Mydei's Kremnoans. It will hold for the time being. Professor Anaxa deployed wards in the north and east before... Their effectiveness is untested, but I believe in him. And Okhema...

speaker: Phainon
line: We needn't fear for Aglaea. Even in death, she counts as the greatest among demigods. Her threads of "Romance" weave an impenetrable shield, and the people answer her call, rallying to the city's defense.

speaker: Phainon
line: Let's move. Kephale has given their Coreflame. We must complete the Era Nova before the next Entry Hour ... for Amphoreus!

speaker: Cyrene
line: That only leaves three hours...

speaker: Phainon
line: So... this is the last time we'll see her .

speaker: Cyrene
line: Phainon...

speaker: Cyrene
line: We set out on this journey to answer the world's desire, didn't we?

speaker: Phainon
line: That's what it means to be a Chrysos Heir. So has it always been.

speaker: Cyrene
line: Then why...

speaker: Cyrene
line: ...Why must Amphoreus's wishes be so... cruel?

speaker: Cyrene
line: We made the best choices we could, whenever we could!

speaker: Cyrene
line: But in the end... the prophecy that led us... this black tide swallowing everything...

speaker: Cyrene
line: Why does it look like this?

speaker: Phainon
line: I... I don't know.

speaker: Phainon
line: But we haven't had any other choice... except to move forward. Not for a long time now.

speaker: Phainon
line: Even if we only see the long, long night ahead, I still believe... that through it, we'll find the dawn on the other side. Beyond these flames, a new sun will someday rise.

speaker: Phainon
line: So, to the Temple of the Three Fates! You'll take over Time's authority, and we'll return all the Coreflames to the Vortex, then put this world's fate to its final rest.

speaker: Phainon
line: After which, we shall all face oblivion...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...or embark on one final grand journey.

speaker: Oronyx
line: *Indistinct mutters*

speaker: Cyrene
line: Please forgive us for disturbing your sleep, Oronyx.

speaker: Oronyx
line: It matters not. I know, fate has run its course.

speaker: Phainon
line: The black tide has reached Okhema. Amphoreus does not have much time left...

speaker: Phainon
line: It is time for the Era Nova.

speaker: Oronyx
line: As agreed, I shall present the Coreflame of Time...

speaker: Oronyx
line: Ride the river of time. It will guard your passage to the Vortex of Genesis...

speaker: Oronyx
line: Step through, and witness.

speaker: Phainon
line: Professor Anaxa proved the truth of Genesis with his sacrifice. As Chrysos Heirs of the prophecy, we were always destined to immolate ourselves for this world...

speaker: Phainon
line: Now it's our turn — we can't let everyone's sacrifices be in vain.

speaker: Cyrene
line: I don't need another pep talk, Phainon.

speaker: Cyrene
line: After all, we've been ready to fight fate ever since we left the village, haven't we?

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Yeah.

speaker: Phainon
line: Come, let's claim the miracle we were promised, and burn away every last shadow in this world...

speaker: Cyrene
line: And then... rise as the first light of a new world.

speaker: Lygus
line: ▶ Light Calendar 4931, the third week of the Month of Evernight. Welcome, my ( Lord / Lady ) (Trailblazer), to the end of the Flame-Chase...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...and the end of all things.

speaker: Lygus
line: The Titan has revealed the gateway of fate. Please, accept the invitation to step across the threshold, and behold!

speaker: Lygus
line: Beyond this gate lies the new world that our heroes sought through their trials, as well as the terminus that the owner of these long memories has been hurtling towards their entire life...

speaker: Lygus
line: Perhaps you'll find it... all too familiar.

speaker: Lygus
line: Then you'll understand how the mortal called "Phainon" shouldered the world's weight. How that same burden crushed him, proving...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...that the so-called "Deliverer" is nothing more than Amphoreus's own delusion, a pitiful fantasy that it could defy fate's decree.

speaker: Lygus
line: Please, esteemed one, the answers you seek lie in these nonexistent times.

text: Follow the two to enter the end of destiny

speaker: Cyrene
line: The future revealed by the Titan...

speaker: Phainon
line: Just what... will we see?

text: Listen to Lygus' explanation of the current situation

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (The Vortex of Genesis... So it is here. But...)

speaker: (Trailblazer)
line: ▶ (Just what is this...?)

speaker: Lygus
line: "Life's but a walking shadow, a poor player, that struts and frets his hour upon the stage, and then is heard no more."

speaker: Lygus
line: "It is a tale, told by an idiot, full of sound and fury, signifying nothing."

speaker: Lygus
line: The Vortex of Genesis, where the world begins and ends. What stage could be more befitting of our final act? Come, come, come, I beseech you onward, buoyed by your surging curiosity.

speaker: Lygus
line: As an unattainable existence that has dwelled within his heart, beyond his reach, you have accompanied him through the march of years uncounted, you naturally have the right to view the river of time in its fullness, and to witness what he welcomed upon his arrival here, every absurd and tragic ending.

text: Keep going to witness the theatrical curtain call

speaker: Lygus
line: Now, if you would.

speaker: Phainon
line: My journey to the Era Nova... it ends here...

speaker: Hyacine
line: When the Era Nova comes, the skies will clear again.

speaker: Aglaea
line: O Deliverer, though you walk alone, please complete the work of bringing about the Era Nova.

speaker: Anaxa
line: Enough talk. Go, make the Era Nova happen in my stead.

speaker: Mydei
line: Hmph! So what if there's only one person left to witness the Era Nova?

speaker: Cipher
line: Now this is one sorry excuse for an Era Nova, Deliverer boy.

speaker: Castorice
line: I just know... Beyond the Era Nova lies a sea of flowers.

speaker: Tribbie
line: Go on, Snowy. Make the Era Nova happen for all of us !

speaker: Phainon
line: None of that matters now. This brutal Flame-Chase Journey has stripped away my delusions. I know the future isn't some peaceful paradise with gentle west winds, just waiting to welcome us to step in...

speaker: Cyrene
line: This will be a romantic story like none that has come before...

speaker: Cyrene
line: You think so too, right?

text: This is... the rest of Phainon and Cyrene's story?
Haven't I... seen this scene before?

speaker: Lygus
line: Indeed! In his memories, such a scene replays over and over. Though the details may differ, this remains ever the same: "All shall bid farewell to one, and that person alone will witness the miracle..."

speaker: Lygus
line: ...A total of 33,550,335 times.

speaker: Lygus
line: Each is a drop from the river of time, representing the long journey he would take, or rather...

speaker: Lygus
line: ...the never-ending cycle.

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: Hehe, just putting it in terms that might be easier for you to understand.

children.speaker: Lygus
children.line: Hehe, sharp as ever, I see.

speaker: Lygus
line: Seeing is believing. Why not let your own two eyes uncover the truth?

speaker: Lygus
line: Or perhaps, you can simply walk straight to the final truth: See the true face of the character you play, and witness the ultimate nature of the Chrysos Heirs, Flame-Chase Journey, and the cycles of Amphoreus.

text: Talk to Lygus to show the final memory

title: Step Description
content: According to (Trailblazer), certain details in this "memory" seem at odds with our journey through Amphoreus. It appears Lygus intended to use this to reveal Amphoreus's true state to (Trailblazer).

speaker: Lygus
line: Please, take your time. Look around as much as you wish.

speaker: Phainon
line: Not a single soul to be seen. So this is how the Vortex looks at the end of days...

speaker: Phainon
line: Hehe... Looks like I've got company after all. But since you've made it here...

speaker: Phainon
line: So, in the end, you succeeded...

speaker: Phainon
line: ...Executioner.

speaker: Phainon
line: Castorice? Didn't you...

speaker: Castorice
line: Yes, I've become Death's demigod, and shall never again walk the world of the living. What you see is the surging of the River of Souls, brought on by the countless dead feeding it in these dark times.

speaker: Castorice
line: They cry out: Though dead, they'll converge into a torrent and guard the Vortex, to see the Era Nova fulfilled.

speaker: Phainon
line: I will take all the wishes of the departed with me. Please, everyone, fight with me, to the very last.

speaker: Castorice
line: I hear them: The dead hail you... they're prepared.

speaker: Castorice
line: Go on, Deliverer. We'll keep that executioner in our shadows — the path before you leads to light and eternal flames.

speaker: Cipher
line: Ugh, there's water everywhere. This place is always all wet and sticky, even my tail's getting heavy...

speaker: Cipher
line: Plus that burnt smell and that sizzling noise... Yikes, nobody from Dolos could stand this.

speaker: Phainon
line: ...So you feel it too.

speaker: Cipher
line: Go on then, I'll handle the filth. Do what you need to do.

speaker: Phainon
